column4: I have made a typo and made a file read-only to user and to root...Is there a way to get permission to change it as root ?
I have made a typo and made a file read-only to user and to root...Is there a way to get permission to change it as root ?
you can change the permissions back with sudo
I can't, I get chmod: changing permissions of `/etc/xinetd.conf': Operation not permitted
I don't have permission as root
'sudo chmod <whatever> /etc/xinetd.conf' does not work??
nope
ls -al /etc/xinetd.conf
-r-------- 1 root root 456 2007-06-10 23:26 /etc/xinetd.conf
post to paste.ubuntu-nl.org the output of cat /proc/mounts
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/25122/
i thought that maybe root fs / got mounted as read only.... not the case... i'm lost with sudo you should do everything you want...
that's because all files have read-write permission for root
I have made a typo and made a file read-only to user and to root...Is there a way to get permission to change it as root ?
that's because all files have read-write permission for root << nothing to do with that...
look here http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/25125/
something else is broken in your setup... maybe weird permissions in /etc/ itself??
post 'ls -l /' in paste.ubuntu-nl.org
nothing isn't broken, i just set the wrong permission and makde it read only to everyone
as you can see in the example i pasted you can change any permisions back to everything you want as easily as you changed them in the first time!!
first you don't need to yell with !!!, second I can't do that because I don't have a permission to chenge it
it seems that you do not need/want my help. Good luck (btw i recomend you to read a basic tutorial on file/dir permisions chmod and chown in unix/linux)
... I want your help but your answer isn't working
I fixed it
